intro: Leandra purpurascens var. claussenii, commonly known as the purple leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
